ch.obermuhlner.jhuge.memory

Class MemoryMappedFileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.obermuhlner.jhuge.memory.AbstractMemoryManager
      • ch.obermuhlner.jhuge.memory.MemoryMappedFileManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MemoryManager

    public class MemoryMappedFileManager
extends AbstractMemoryManager
    Uses direct mapped buffers to store the managed memory blocks outside of the Java heap.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GIGABYTES
      The number of bytes in a gigabyte.
      static int KILOBYTES
      The number of bytes in a kilobyte.
      static int MEGABYTES
      The number of bytes in a megabyte.
      static int NO_BLOCK_SIZE
      The constant to specify that allocated blocks will always have exactly the specified length and not be quantified to a block size.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MemoryMappedFileManager()
      Constructs a MemoryMappedFileManager with a default buffer size of 100 megabytes and no block quantification.
      MemoryMappedFileManager(int bufferSize)
      Constructs a MemoryMappedFileManager with the specified buffer size and no block quantification.
      MemoryMappedFileManager(int bufferSize, int blockSize)
      Constructs a MemoryMappedFileManager with the specified buffer and block size.
      MemoryMappedFileManager(int bufferSize, int blockSize, int allowedBlockOversize, boolean compactAfterFree)
      Constructs a MemoryMappedFileManager with the specified configuration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MemoryMappedFileManager

        public MemoryMappedFileManager()
        Constructs a MemoryMappedFileManager with a default buffer size of 100 megabytes and no block quantification.

      • MemoryMappedFileManager

        public MemoryMappedFileManager(int bufferSize)
        Constructs a MemoryMappedFileManager with the specified buffer size and no block quantification.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - the buffer size

      • MemoryMappedFileManager

        public MemoryMappedFileManager(int bufferSize,
                       int blockSize)
        Constructs a MemoryMappedFileManager with the specified buffer and block size.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - the buffer size
        blockSize - the block size, or NO_BLOCK_SIZE to use no block quantification

      • MemoryMappedFileManager

        public MemoryMappedFileManager(int bufferSize,
                       int blockSize,
                       int allowedBlockOversize,
                       boolean compactAfterFree)
        Constructs a MemoryMappedFileManager with the specified configuration.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - the buffer size
        blockSize - the block size, or NO_BLOCK_SIZE to use no block quantification
        allowedBlockOversize - the allowed block oversize when searching for a fitting free block
        compactAfterFree - compact after freeing a block

    • Method Detail

      • getBufferSize

        public int getBufferSize()
        Returns the buffer size.
        Returns:
        the buffer size

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
        Returns the block size.
        Returns:
        the block size, or NO_BLOCK_SIZE

      • allocate

        public long allocate(int length)
        Allocates a memory block of the specified length.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the memory block to allocate
        Returns:
        the address of the allocated memory block
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified length is greater than the buffer size

      • read

        public byte[] read(long address)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryManager
        Returns the content of the memory block at the specified address.

        The returned byte array is a copy of the memory block. Modifying the byte array will not modify the memory block. Use MemoryManager.write(long, byte[]) to do this.

        Parameters:
        address - the address of the memory block to read
        Returns:
        the content of the memory block

      • write

        public void write(long address,
         byte[] data)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryManager
        Writes the content of the specified byte array into the block at the specified address.

        The byte array may not be longer than the length of the allocated memory block.

        Parameters:
        address - the address of the memory block to write
        data - the content to write into the memory block

      • free

        public void free(long address)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryManager
        Frees the memory block at the specified address.

        The freed address may or may not be reused in later allocations.

        Parameters:
        address - the address of the memory block to free

      • compact

        public void compact()
        Compacts the free memory blocks.

        This might lead to larger free memory blocks.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: MemoryManager
        Resets the memory manager.

        This frees all allocated memory blocks.

        If possible any resources allocated by the memory manager in order to fulfill the allocation requests are freed.

      • getFreeBlockSizes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getFreeBlockSizes()
        Returns the sizes of the free memory blocks.
        Returns:
        a snapshot of the sizes of the the free memory blocks

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
